title: Chinese Embassy sends teachers and students of Samoa College to Huizhou
description: On September 11th, 2017, a farewell ceremony was held in the Chinese Embassy of Samoa to launch a 10-day study tour organized for 10 Samoan youth to travel to Huizhou, China as part of a cultural exchange program. Three teachers and seven students from Samoa College went to Huizhou City in Guangdong Province and Hualuogeng Secondary School. The project was termed: "Discovering Huizhou - a Tour of Friendship between Chinese and Samoan Youngsters". This project was part of an MOU signed in 2015, "MOU Establishing a Sister-School Relationship between Huizhou Hualuogeng Secondary School and Samoa College".  During the 10-day tour in China, teachers, and students from Samoa College participated in a variety of activities including attending math, music and culture classes, paper-cutting, painting, mini fun games and music, and song performances with their Chinese peers. They were also invited to spend time in Chinese students' families. A TV documentary that followed this project was aired on major Samoan TV stations on December 12th-18th, 2017.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
Chinese Embassy sends teachers and students of Samoa College to Huizhou

# Description
On September 11th, 2017, a farewell ceremony was held in the Chinese Embassy of Samoa to launch a 10-day study tour organized for 10 Samoan youth to travel to Huizhou, China as part of a cultural exchange program. Three teachers and seven students from Samoa College went to Huizhou City in Guangdong Province and Hualuogeng Secondary School. The project was termed: "Discovering Huizhou - a Tour of Friendship between Chinese and Samoan Youngsters". This project was part of an MOU signed in 2015, "MOU Establishing a Sister-School Relationship between Huizhou Hualuogeng Secondary School and Samoa College".  During the 10-day tour in China, teachers, and students from Samoa College participated in a variety of activities including attending math, music and culture classes, paper-cutting, painting, mini fun games and music, and song performances with their Chinese peers. They were also invited to spend time in Chinese students' families. A TV documentary that followed this project was aired on major Samoan TV stations on December 12th-18th, 2017.
justification: Cultural exchange program focused on education and cultural understanding without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Education sector project, cultural exchange activities, sister-school relationship

title: China donated 20 brand new cars to assist the government to host the 48th annual Pacific Leaders
description: In August 2017, China donated 20 vehicles to the Government of Samoa to assist with transportation when Samoa hosts the 48th annual Pacific Leaders Summit. According to Radio New Zealand, as of August 28, 2017 the cars had arrived in the country and an official handover ceremony was to be held in within the next week. The total cost of this donation is unclear.
combined_text:
# Sector
GOVERNMENT AND CIVIL SOCIETY

# Title
China donated 20 brand new cars to assist the government to host the 48th annual Pacific Leaders

# Description
In August 2017, China donated 20 vehicles to the Government of Samoa to assist with transportation when Samoa hosts the 48th annual Pacific Leaders Summit. According to Radio New Zealand, as of August 28, 2017 the cars had arrived in the country and an official handover ceremony was to be held in within the next week. The total cost of this donation is unclear.
justification: Project involves donation of vehicles for government use during a summit, with no clear environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of 20 vehicles for government transportation needs during Pacific Leaders Summit

title: Chinese Government provides ST$30 million grant for Multipurpose Sport Gymnasium Construction and Sports Facilities Refurbishment Project (Linked to Project ID#64861, #64864, #64765)
description: On May 24, 2017, the Chinese Government signed a grant agreement with the Government of Samoa worth approximately ST$30 million for the Multipurpose Sport Gymnasium Construction and Sports Facilities Refurbishment Project. The purpose of the project was to   (a) construct a multipurpose gymnasium (known locally as the Multi-Sport Centre and the Faleata Multisport Gymnasium) in the Tuanaimato area of the city of Apia; and  (b) refurbish the Samoa Aquatic Centre, Apia Park Main Stadium, Apia Park Gymnasium, and Apia Park Tennis Court.   These five sporting facilities were meant to serve as venues for the 2019 (XVI) Pacific Games in July 2019. Anhui Construction and Shanghai Construction were the contractors responsible for implementation. The multipurpose gymnasium consists of two state-of-the-art indoor and outdoor netball courts built to international specifications. It also has the capacity to host badminton, basketball, table tennis, boxing and other indoor sports. Its floor space covers an area of 40,000 square meters and is equipped with 1600 spectator seats.   When Samoa won the bid to host the 2019 (XVI) Pacific Games after Tonga withdrew its hosting status in May 2017, the Government of Samoa submitted a proposal to the Chinese Government to assist it with the rehabilitation of existing sporting facilities (built with financial support from the Chinese Government). A team of engineers from China arrived at the beginning of 2018 to conduct a thorough study of the proposed project and the study concluded that the gymnasium at Apia Park was not structurally safe and was no longer fit for competition purposes. Eventually, a decision was made to construct a new multipurpose gymnasium in the Tuanaimato area of Apia rather than in the Apia Park area. Refurbishment activities would be focused on the existing facilities in Apia Park.  Anhui Foreign Economic Construction Corporation and Shanghai Construction Group (SCG) were the contractors responsible for project implementation. A groundbreaking ceremony was held on September 19, 2018. 200 Chinese engineers and workers were employed during the construction phase. The Chinese Ambassador to Samoa conducted on-site project inspections on February 18, 2019 and April 19, 2019 and the project was officially completed and handed over to the local authorities on June 30, 2019 (ahead of the 16th Pacific Games, which were held in Apia from July 7, 2019 to July 20, 2019).
staff_comments: Staff Note 1: The Chinese project title is 援萨摩亚太平洋运动会体育场馆项目 or 萨摩亚太平洋运动会体育场馆项目 or 集团南太运动会主场馆项目. This project is also known as the Multi-purpose Sport Gymnasium Project and the Samoa Sports Facilities Project for the 2019 Pacific Games. Staff Note 2: Project ID#64861, #64864, #64765 capture other Chinese Government-funded efforts to maintain and renovate the Apia Sports Complex and Aquatic Center in 2005, 2015, and 2017, respectively. See Project ID#64047 and #64042 for additional Chinese Government financing in support of the 2019 Pacific Games.
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER SOCIAL INFRASTRUCTURE AND SERVICES

# Title

title: Shanghai Construction Group donated US$160000 to Samoa Rugby Union
description: In 2017, Shanghai Construction Group donated US$160,000.00 to the Samoa Rugby Union. The purpose of this funding is to help pay for the insurance of Manu Samoa players who are in Europe for their Northern Hemisphere tour, and to pay the salary of coach, Fuimaono Titimaea Tafua. The exact date of the grant, which took place during a Radiothon, is unknown.
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER SOCIAL INFRASTRUCTURE AND SERVICES

# Title
Shanghai Construction Group donated US$160000 to Samoa Rugby Union

# Description
In 2017, Shanghai Construction Group donated US$160,000.00 to the Samoa Rugby Union. The purpose of this funding is to help pay for the insurance of Manu Samoa players who are in Europe for their Northern Hemisphere tour, and to pay the salary of coach, Fuimaono Titimaea Tafua. The exact date of the grant, which took place during a Radiothon, is unknown.
justification: Project is a donation for sports-related purposes with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation to Samoa Rugby Union for player insurance and coach salary, social infrastructure sector

title: Chinese Embassy sends six Samoan workers to China for training in the leather industry
description: In October 2017, the Chinese Embassy in Samoa sent six worker from the leather industry in Samoa to Shandong, China, to attend the "2017 Training Class for the Leather Product Processing and Import and Export Trade in Developing Countries". The training lasted four weeks, and trained the workers in leather processing technology, and helped them understand the development trend of the world leather trade. They listened to lectures, went to China's Zhaoyuan Leather City, and visited companies in Zibo, Qingdao, Xinji, and Hebei.
combined_text:
# Sector
BUSINESS AND OTHER SERVICES

# Title
Chinese Embassy sends six Samoan workers to China for training in the leather industry

# Description
In October 2017, the Chinese Embassy in Samoa sent six worker from the leather industry in Samoa to Shandong, China, to attend the "2017 Training Class for the Leather Product Processing and Import and Export Trade in Developing Countries". The training lasted four weeks, and trained the workers in leather processing technology, and helped them understand the development trend of the world leather trade. They listened to lectures, went to China's Zhaoyuan Leather City, and visited companies in Zibo, Qingdao, Xinji, and Hebei.
justification: Project focuses on worker training and capacity building without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Training program for leather industry workers, focus on skills development and trade knowledge

title: China awards scholarships to 22 Samoan students
description: On August 18, 2017, the Chinese Embassy in Samoa hosted a reception for 22 students who had received a chinese government scholarship. Following the reception, the students will leave to study in China. Since 1982, Samoan students have been going to China on Chinese government scholarships, for a total of 230 students in 2017.  Exact start and end dates for study are unclear.

EDUCATION

title: Chinese Embassy sends 32 Samoan apparel workers to China for training
description: On July 21, 2017, the Chinese Embassy in Samoa held a seminar called the "2017 Samoa Apparel Industry Trade Seminar". Thirty-two of the people who attended that seminar then went to another seminar held in China. The people were apparel business operators, designers, media representatives, etc. Participants learned about the development status of China's apparel industry, import and export trade and e-commerce practices, and the development of the apparel small commodity market. Further, they will visit apparel companies in China and the international commodity market in Yiwu.  The exact end date for the training in China is unclear.
combined_text:
# Sector
BUSINESS AND OTHER SERVICES

# Title
Chinese Embassy sends 32 Samoan apparel workers to China for training

# Description
On July 21, 2017, the Chinese Embassy in Samoa held a seminar called the "2017 Samoa Apparel Industry Trade Seminar". Thirty-two of the people who attended that seminar then went to another seminar held in China. The people were apparel business operators, designers, media representatives, etc. Participants learned about the development status of China's apparel industry, import and export trade and e-commerce practices, and the development of the apparel small commodity market. Further, they will visit apparel companies in China and the international commodity market in Yiwu.  The exact end date for the training in China is unclear.
justification: Project focuses on skills training and knowledge transfer in apparel industry, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Training program for apparel workers, focus on industry development and trade practices

title: China hosts 19 Samoan chefs for a culinary skills training course
description: From September 10 to October 1, 2017, 19 Samoan chefs were in Shandong Province in China to attend the "Training Course for Culinary Skills for Samoa in 2017". The Chinese Ministry of Commerce sponsored this project and Shandong Foreign Trade Vocational College hosted the participants. It is unclear when the Chinese Ministry of Commerce committed to financing this training course.   The group was mainly professional chefs, but also included a few boutique owners and a few home cooks. Participants learned about ingredients, varied cooking processes, and the presentation of the food for guests. They were also given lectures on Chinese history and culture, and the role that food plays in it. The chefs were also treated to tours throughout China. At the end of the training, the chefs graduated with degrees from the Shandong Foreign Trade Vocational College and from the Shandong Provincial Labor and Employment Training Center.

title: China donates $40,000 to Samoa Voyaging Society for trip to New Zealand
description: At the end of 2017, the Samoa Voyaging Society was invited to attend a Waka Festival in New Zealand the following year. On November 14, 2017, the Chinese Embassy gave the society $40,000 to assist with preparation for the trip. The voyaging society will be in New Zealand from January to March.
combined_text:
# Sector
TRANSPORT AND STORAGE

# Title
China donates $40,000 to Samoa Voyaging Society for trip to New Zealand

# Description
At the end of 2017, the Samoa Voyaging Society was invited to attend a Waka Festival in New Zealand the following year. On November 14, 2017, the Chinese Embassy gave the society $40,000 to assist with preparation for the trip. The voyaging society will be in New Zealand from January to March.
justification: Project is a cultural exchange initiative with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation for cultural voyage, no energy or infrastructure components

title: China donates lawn mowers and sports equipment to three Samoan schools
description: Around July 26, 2017, the Chinese Ambassador to Samoa visited three mountain schools in Samoa: the St. Peter's School, Elefah Elementary School, and Rhone Elementary School. While visiting the St. Peter's School, he donated lawn mowers, alongside football, volleyball, and other sports equipment to the three schools.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
China donates lawn mowers and sports equipment to three Samoan schools

# Description
Around July 26, 2017, the Chinese Ambassador to Samoa visited three mountain schools in Samoa: the St. Peter's School, Elefah Elementary School, and Rhone Elementary School. While visiting the St. Peter's School, he donated lawn mowers, alongside football, volleyball, and other sports equipment to the three schools.
justification: Project involves donation of educational and recreational equipment with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of lawn mowers and sports equipment to schools, education sector focus
